sen.j: 流造（ながれづくり）は、日本の神社建築の1つである。
sen.e: Nagare-zukuri style is one of architectural styles for Japanese shrines.
Nagare-zukuri style is an architectural style of Japanese shrines.
Nagare-zukuri style is an architectural style of Japanese shrines.

sen.j: 賀茂別雷神社（上賀茂神社）、賀茂御祖神社（下鴨神社）に代表される流造は、伊勢神宮に代表される神明造から発展した。
sen.e: The nagare-zukuri style, which is represented by Kamowakeikazuchi-jinja shrine (Kamigamo-jinja shrine) and Kamomioya-jinja shrine (Shimogamo-jinja shrine), is an advanced variation of the Shinmei-zukuri style, which is represented by Ise-jingu shrine.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The nagare-zukuri style, which is represented by Kamowakeikazuchi-jinja shrine (Kamigamo-jinja shrine) and Kamomioya-jinja shrine (Shimogamo-jinja shrine), is an advanced variation of the Shinmei-zukuri style, which is represented by Ise-jingu shrine.

The nagare-zukuri style, which is represented by Kamowakeikazuchi-jinja Shrine (Kamigamo-jinja Shrine) and Kamomioya-jinja Shrine (Shimogamo-jinja Shrine), is an advanced variation of the Shinmei-zukuri style, which is represented by Ise-jingu Shrine.
sen.cmt: これらの shrine は全てShrine に修正しました。

sen.j: 屋根が反り、屋根が前に曲線形に長く伸びて向拝（こうはい、庇）となったもの。
sen.e: The style is characterized by a long extended and curved front slope of the warped roof, which constitutes a Kohai (eave).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The style is characterized by a long-extending, curved front slope of the warped roof, which constitutes a Kohai (eave).
The style is characterized by a long-extending, curved front slope of the warped roof, which constitutes a kohai (eave).

sen.j: 全国で最も多い神社建築である。
sen.e: This is the most popular architectural style among Japanese shrines
This is the most popular architectural style among Japanese shrines
This is the most popular architectural style among Japanese shrines

sen.j: 流造の構造は、切妻造・平入であり、屋根には大社造同様の優美な曲線が与えられる。
sen.e: The nagare-zukuri style employs a Kirizuma-zukuri/Hirairi structure, and its roof forms a graceful curve similar to that of Taisha-zukuri style.
The nagare-zukuri style employs a Kirizuma-zukuri/Hirairi structure, and its roof forms a graceful curve similar to that of Taisha-zukuri style.
The nagare-zukuri style employs a kirizuma-zukuri/hirairi structure, and its roof forms a graceful curve similar to that of taisha-zukuri style.

sen.j: この点で直線的な外観の神明造と異なる。
sen.e: This makes the nagare-zukuri style different from the shinmei-zukuri style, which is characterized by its straight external appearance.
This makes the nagare-zukuri style different from the shinmei-zukuri style, which is characterized by its straight external appearance.
This makes the nagare-zukuri style different from the shinmei-zukuri style, which is characterized by its straight external appearance.

sen.j: 神明造と異なり、萱葺に限らず柿葺や檜皮葺など幅広い。
sen.e: Unlike the shinmei-zukuri style, the roof may be covered not only with miscanthus reeds but also with a variety of materials, such as kokeras (thin plates of wood), cypress bark shingles, etc.
Unlike the shinmei-zukuri style, the roof may be covered not only with miscanthus reeds but also with a variety of materials, such as kokeras (thin plates of wood), cypress bark shingles, etc.
Unlike the shinmei-zukuri style, the roof is not only thatched but also covered with a variety of materials, such as kokeras (thin plates of wood), cypress bark shingles, etc.
sen.cmt: 萱葺き: thatched, として修正しました。

sen.j: 側面の破風は懸魚などで修飾され、優美な曲線を描く。
sen.e: Each of the gables of the roof is decorated with a Gegyo (decoration board) and forms a graceful curve.
Each of the gables of the roof is decorated with a Gegyo (decoration board) and forms a graceful curve.
Each of the gables of the roof is decorated with a gegyo (decoration board) and forms a graceful curve.

sen.j: 屋根の勾配はきつくない。
sen.e: The slope of the roof is not steep.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The slope of the roof is not steep.
The slope of the roof is not steep.

sen.j: 前面に長く流れるように伸びる蓑甲（みのこう）から向拝にかけての曲線を強調する。
sen.e: The roof is characterized by a long curve which smoothly and forwardly extends from the minoko (curved surface portion for adjustment) to the kohai.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The roof is characterized by a long curve which smoothly extends forward from the minoko (curved surface portion for adjustment) to the kohai.
The roof is characterized by a long curve which smoothly extends forward from the minoko (curved surface portion for adjustment) to the kohai.

sen.j: 柱
sen.e: Columns
Columns
Columns

sen.j: 神明造同様、左右対称で、左右方向には偶数本の柱が配される。
sen.e: Similar to the shinmei-zukuri style, the nagare-zukuri style is bilaterally symmetric, and an even-numbered number of columns are provided in the width direction.
Similar to the shinmei-zukuri style, the nagare-zukuri style is bilaterally symmetric, and an even number of columns are provided in the width direction.
Similar to the shinmei-zukuri style, the nagare-zukuri style is bilaterally symmetric, and an even number of columns are provided in the width direction.

sen.j: 母屋の柱は丸柱、向拝は面取角柱で上に舟肘木を載せる。
sen.e: Round columns and chamfered rectangular columns are respectively used for the building and the kohai, and a funahijiki (horizontal member) is provided on each of the rectangular columns.
Round columns and chamfered rectangular columns are respectively used for the building and the kohai, and a funahijiki (horizontal member) is provided on each of the rectangular columns.
Round columns and chamfered rectangular columns are respectively used for the building and the kohai, and a funahijiki (horizontal member) is provided on each of the rectangular columns.

sen.j: 桁行（横に並んだ柱の間）が1間であれば（柱が2本）一間社流造、3間であれば（柱が4本）三間社流造という。
sen.e: When the Ketayuki (the distance between columns in the width direction) is one ken (1.8182 m) (the number of the columns is two), it is called as Ikkensha-nagare-zukuri style, and when the distance is three kens (5.4546 m), it is called as sangensha-nagare-zukuri style (the number of the columns is four).

When the Ketayuki (the distance between columns in the width direction) is one ken (1.8182 m) (the number of columns is two), it is called Ikkensha-nagare-zukuri style, and when the distance is three kens (5.4546 m), it is called sangensha-nagare-zukuri style (the number of columns is four).

When the ketayuki (the distance between columns in the width direction) is one ken (1.8182 m) (the number of columns is two), it is called ikkensha-nagare-zukuri style, and when the distance is three kens (5.4546 m), it is called sangensha-nagare-zukuri style (the number of columns is four).

sen.j: 壁
sen.e: Walls
Walls
Walls

sen.j: 正面中央の1か所に観音開きの御扉による開口部が設けられる。
sen.e: An opening with a biparting door is provided in the central portion of the front wall.
An opening with a biparting door is provided in the central portion of the front wall.
An opening with a butterfly formation door is provided in the central portion of the front wall.
sen.cmt: 観音開き: butterfly formation とし、修正しました。

sen.j: 床
sen.e: Floors
Floors
Floors

sen.j: 土台の高さに浜床、階段上に母屋床をはる。
sen.e: A hamaita floor is provided at the height of the groundsill, and a building floor is provided at the height of the staircase.
A hamaita floor is provided at the height of the groundsill, and a building floor is provided at the height of the staircase.
A hamayuka floor is provided at the height of the groundsill, and a building floor is provided at the height of the staircase.

sen.j: 神明造の発展型であることから歴史は浅い。
sen.e: Because it is an advanced variation of the shinmei-zukuri style, its history is not long.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because it is an advanced variation of the shinmei-zukuri style, its history is not long.
Because it is an advanced variation of the shinmei-zukuri style, its history is not long.

sen.j: 現存する最古のものは宇治上神社本殿で、平安時代後期の建築である。
sen.e: The oldest surviving nagare-zukuri style building is the honden (main hall) of Ujigami-jinja shrine, which was built in the latter half of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The oldest surviving nagare-zukuri style building is the honden (main hall) of Ujigami-jinja shrine, which was built in the latter half of the Heian period.
The oldest surviving nagare-zukuri style building is the honden (main hall) of Ujigami-jinja Shrine, which was built in the latter half of the Heian period.
